intro: Siphocampylus bilabiatus var. glabratus, commonly known as the smooth-lipped siphocampylus, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and compound leaves with a finely divided structure. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Due to its rarity, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
